result.execSummary:
All charges against MARVIN C. KERSTEN in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. MARVIN C. KERSTEN is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

BAIL JUMP - FELONY
CONDITIONS:    ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant shall not enter any establishment in which their primary purpose is the sale of alcohol;  COMPLY WITH CONDITIONS OF THE ALCOHOL 24/7 PROGRAM. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing. THE DEFENDANT SHALL BRING THE ALCOHOL MONITORING DEVICE TO EVERY HEARING.  NO POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION OF ALCOHOL.

02:51 PM Defendant MARVIN C. KERSTEN in court, in custody.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  MARVIN C. KERSTEN appeared by video means.  24/7 VIOLATION.  Advised of rights.  DE unsure if he wants to go forward without his attorney RECESS @ 2:54. 
RECALLED @ 3:14 Attorney Morley makes a special appearance.  The State requests bond increased by $250 cash.  Defense doesn't object.  The Court will set a $5,250.00 cash bond.   The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 3:19.
24/7 violation

9:41 AM Attorney John Miller Carroll appeared by phone means for Defendant MARVIN C. KERSTEN. Prosecuting Atty Tracy Ann Paider appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant MARVIN C. KERSTEN appeared by video means.    Information received by Defendant, waives formal reading and enters a not guilty plea.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arraignment on February 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
